content.raw:
SDF is a more general format than URDF, since it can handle kinematic graphs and not just kinematic trees.

Some applications have advantages in using URDF's, though. If you have a URDF, then you know it is a tree, which is useful for control and planning. It also has recursive coordinate frames, which makes it easier to set up Featherstone-based simualtions (Erwin, for example, prefers URDF for testing bullet's Featherstone implementation).

If we make a URDF->SDF converter, perhaps we could keep the original URDF code somewhere as metadata to simplify the reverse conversion of SDF->URDF?

I'm just trying to say that URDF will be more convenient for some users, so we should try to think about what we expect them to do.
